summary: This document is an email chain from October 2021 between a DOJ OIG investigator and a Communication Technician at MCC New York regarding an investigation into a DVR system failure on July 29, 2019. The technician provides details about replacing hard drives and the involvement of other personnel, in response to questions about camera system issues at the Metropolitan Correctional Center around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

keyFacts: A DVR system failure occurred at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on July 29, 2019, which was under investigation by the DOJ OIG in 2021.
Communication Technician Mr. M replaced two hard drives to repair the system in July 2019, using old drives on hand because no new parts were available.
The camera system equipment was described as being 'at the end of life' with no available parts in August 2019.
The investigation sought details on work orders, communications with BOP and SigNet employees, and the involvement of other MCC staff regarding the camera system issues.
The email chain shows the OIG's specific focus on the timing and cause of the DVR failure around July 29, 2019, and the technician's activities on that date.
